share.name: Share section
share.desc: This section describes variables that are used by more than one WPS program. For example, the wrf_core variable specifies whether the WPS is to produce data for the ARW or the NMM core- information which is needed by both the geogrid and metgrid programs

wrf_core.name: WRF core
wrf_core.desc: A character string set to either 'ARW' or 'NMM' that tells the WPS which dynamical core the input data are being prepared for

start_dates.name: Start Date
start_dates.desc: A list character strings of the form 'YYYY-MM-DD_HH:mm:ss' specifying the starting UTC date of the simulation for each nest

end_dates.name: End Date
end_dates.desc: A list of character strings of the form 'YYYY-MM-DD_HH:mm:ss' specifying the ending UTC date of the simulation for each nest

interval_seconds.name: Interval seconds
interval_seconds.desc: The integer number of seconds between time-varying meteorological input files.

max_dom.name: max domain
max_dom.desc: An integer specifying the total number of domains/nests, including the parent domain, in the simulation

io_form_geogrid.name: I/O form geogrid
io_form_geogrid.desc: The WRF I/O API format that the domain files created by the geogrid program will be written in. Possible options are: 1 for binary; 2 for NetCDF; 3 for GRIB1. When option 1 is given, domain files will have a suffix of .int; when option 2 is given, domain files will have a suffix of .nc; when option 3 is given, domain files will have a suffix of .gr1. Default value is 2 (NetCDF)

geogrid.name: Geogrid section
geogrid.desc: This section specifies variables that are specific to the geogrid program. Variables in the geogrid section primarily define the size and location of all model domains, and where the static geographical data are found.

parent_ids.name: Parent ID
parent_ids.desc: A list of MAX_DOM integers specifying, for each nest, the domain number of the nest's parent; for the coarsest domain, this variable should be set to 1

parent_grid_ratios.name: Parent grid ratio
parent_grid_ratios.desc: A list of integers specifying, for each nest, the nesting ratio relative to the domain's parent

i_parent_starts.name: I-parent start
i_parent_starts.desc: A list of integers specifying, for each nest, the x-coordinate of the lower-left corner of the nest in the parent unstaggered grid. For the coarsest domain, a value of 1 should be specified

j_parent_starts.name: J-parent start
j_parent_starts.desc: A list of MAX_DOM integers specifying, for each nest, the x-coordinate of the lower-left corner of the nest in the parent unstaggered grid. For the coarsest domain, a value of 1 should be specified

e_wes.name: E-WE
e_wes.desc: A list of MAX_DOM integers specifying, for each nest, the nest's full west-east dimension. For nested domains, e_we must be one greater than an integer multiple of the nest's parent_grid_ratio (i.e., e_we = n*parent_grid_ratio+1 for some positive integer n)

e_sns.name: E-SN
e_sns.desc: A list of MAX_DOM integers specifying, for each nest, the nest's full south-north dimension. For nested domains, e_sn must be one greater than an integer multiple of the nest's parent_grid_ratio (i.e., e_sn = n*parent_grid_ratio+1 for some positive integer n)

g_data_res.name: GEOG_DATA_RES
g_data_res.desc: A list of MAX_DOM character strings specifying, for each nest, a corresponding resolution or list of resolutions separated by + symbols of source data to be used when interpolating static terrestrial data to the nest's grid

dx.name: DX
dx.desc: A real value specifying the grid distance in the x-direction where the map scale factor is 1

dy.name: DY
dy.desc: A real value specifying the grid distance in the y-direction where the map scale factor is 1

map_proj.name: Map projection
map_proj.desc: A character string specifying the projection of the simulation domain. For ARW, accepted projections are 'lambert', 'polar', 'mercator', and 'lat-lon'; for NMM, a projection of 'rotated_ll' must be specified

ref_lat.name: Ref-latitude
ref_lat.desc: A real value specifying the latitude part of a (latitude, longitude) location whose (i,j) location in the simulation domain is known

ref_lon.name: Ref-longitude
ref_lon.desc: A real value specifying the longitude part of a (latitude, longitude) location whose (i, j) location in the simulation domain is known

truelat1.name: True Latitude
truelat1.desc: A real value specifying, for ARW, the first true latitude for the Lambert conformal projection, or the only true latitude for the Mercator and polar stereographic projections.

truelat2.name: True Longitude
truelat2.desc: A real value specifying, for ARW, the second true latitude for the Lambert conformal conic projection. For all other projections, truelat2 is ignored.

stand_lon.name: Stand-Longitude
stand_lon.desc: A real value specifying, for ARW, the longitude that is parallel with the y-axis in the Lambert conformal and polar stereographic projections. For the regular latitude-longitude projection, this value gives the rotation about the earth's geographic poles

geog_data_path.name: Geogrid data path
geog_data_path.desc: A character string giving the path, either relative or absolute, to the directory where the geographical data directories may be found. This path is the one to which rel_path specifications in the GEOGRID.TBL file are given in relation to.

OPT_GEOGRID_TBL_PATH.name: Opt-Geogrid-TBL-path
OPT_GEOGRID_TBL_PATH.desc: A character string giving the path, either relative or absolute, to the GEOGRID.TBL file. The path should not contain the actual file name, as GEOGRID.TBL is assumed, but should only give the path where this file is located.

ungrib.name: Ungrib section
ungrib.desc: Currently, this section contains only two variables, which determine the output format written by ungrib and the name of the output files

out_format.name: Output Format
out_format.desc: A character string set either to 'WPS', 'SI', or 'MM5'. If set to 'MM5', ungrib will write output in the format of the MM5 pregrid program; if set to 'SI', ungrib will write output in the format of grib_prep.exe; if set to 'WPS', ungrib will write data in the WPS intermediate format

prefix.name: Prefix
prefix.desc: A character string that will be used as the prefix for intermediate-format files created by ungrib; here, prefix refers to the string PREFIX in the filename PREFIX:YYYY-MM-DD_HH of an intermediate file. The prefix may contain path information, either relative or absolute, in which case the intermediate files will be written in the directory specified. This option may be useful to avoid renaming intermediate files if ungrib is to be run on multiple sources of GRIB data.

metgrid.name: Metgrid section
metgrid.desc: This section defines variables used only by the metgrid program. Typically, the user will be interested in the fg_name variable, and may need to modify other variables of this section less frequently

fg_name.name: FG_name
fg_name.desc: A list of character strings specifying the path and prefix of ungribbed data files. The path may be relative or absolute, and the prefix should contain all characters of the filenames up to, but not including, the colon preceding the date. When more than one fg_name is specified, and the same field is found in two or more input sources, the data in the last encountered source will take priority over all preceding sources for that field

io_form_metgrid.name: I/O form metgrid
io_form_metgrid.desc: The WRF I/O API format that the output created by the metgrid program will be written in. Possible options are: 1 for binary; 2 for NetCDF; 3 for GRIB1. When option 1 is given, output files will have a suffix of .int; when option 2 is given, output files will have a suffix of .nc; when option 3 is given, output files will have a suffix of .gr1

mod_levs.name: Mod_levs
mod_levs.desc: The mod_levs.exe program is used to remove levels of data from intermediate format files. The levels which are to be kept are specified in a new namelist record in the namelist.wps file

start_years.name: Start Year
start_years.desc: A list of MAX_DOM 4-digit integers specifying the starting UTC year of the simulation for each nest

start_months.name: Start month
start_months.desc: A list of integers specifying the starting UTC month of the simulation for each nest

start_days.name: Start day
start_days.desc: A list of integers specifying the starting UTC day of the simulation for each nest.

start_hours.name: Start hour
start_hours.desc: A list of integers specifying the starting UTC hour of the simulation for each nest

start_minutes.name: Start minute
start_minutes.desc: A list of integers specifying the starting UTC minute of the simulation for each nest

start_seconds.name: Start seconds
start_seconds.desc: A list of integers specifying the starting UTC second of the simulation for each nest

end_years.name: End Year
end_years.desc: A list of integers specifying the ending UTC year of the simulation for each nest.

end_months.name: End month
end_months.desc: A list of integers specifying the ending UTC month of the simulation for each nest.

end_days.name: End day
end_days.desc: A list of integers specifying the ending UTC day of the simulation for each nest.

end_hours.name: End Hour
end_hours.desc: A list of integers specifying the ending UTC hour of the simulation for each nest.

end_minutes.name: End minute
end_minutes.desc: A list of integers specifying the ending UTC minute of the simulation for each nest.

end_seconds.name: End second
end_seconds.desc: A list of integers specifying the ending UTC second of the simulation for each nest.

interval_seconds.name: Interval seconds\
interval_seconds.desc: The integer number of seconds between time-varying meteorological input files

input_from_files.name: Input from file
input_from_files.desc: Whether the nested run will have input files for domains other than domain 1

history_intervals.name: History interval
history_intervals.desc: History output file interval in minutes

frames_per_outfiles.name: Frames per outfile
frames_per_outfiles.desc: number of output times bulked into each history file; used to split output files into smaller pieces

restart.name: Restart
restart.desc: Whether this run is a restart

restart_interval.name: Restart interval
restart_interval.desc: Restart output file interval in minutes

io_form_history.name: I/O form history
io_form_history.desc: The format in which the history output file will be

io_form_restart.name: I/O form restart
io_form_restart.desc: The format in which the restart output files will be

io_form_input.name: I/O form input
io_form_input.desc: The format of the input files. 2 is netCDF

io_form_boundary.name: I/O form boundary
io_form_boundary.desc: The format for the wrfbdy file. 2is netCDF format

debug_level.name: Debug level
debug_level.desc: Giving this a larger value increases the debugging print-outs when running WRF

time_step.name: Time step
time_step.desc: Time step for integration seconds (recommended 6*dx in km for a typical case)

max_dom.name: Max domain
max_dom.desc: The number of domains over which you are running

parent_ids.name: Parent ID
parent_ids.desc: A list of MAX_DOM integers specifying, for each nest, the domain number of the nest's parent; for the coarsest domain, this variable should be set to 1

parent_grid_ratios.name: Parent grid ratio
parent_grid_ratios.desc: A list of integers specifying, for each nest, the nesting ratio relative to the domain's parent

i_parent_starts.name: I-parent start
i_parent_starts.desc: A list of integers specifying, for each nest, the x-coordinate of the lower-left corner of the nest in the parent unstaggered grid. For the coarsest domain, a value of 1 should be specified

j_parent_starts.name: J-parent start
j_parent_starts.desc: A list of MAX_DOM integers specifying, for each nest, the x-coordinate of the lower-left corner of the nest in the parent unstaggered grid. For the coarsest domain, a value of 1 should be specified

e_wes.name: E-WE
e_wes.desc: A list of integers specifying, for each nest, the nest's full west-east dimension. For nested domains, e_we must be one greater than an integer multiple of the nest's parent_grid_ratio (i.e., e_we = n*parent_grid_ratio+1 for some positive integer n)

e_sns.name: E-SN
e_sns.desc: A list of integers specifying, for each nest, the nest's full south-north dimension. For nested domains, e_sn must be one greater than an integer multiple of the nest's parent_grid_ratio (i.e., e_sn = n*parent_grid_ratio+1 for some positive integer n)

s_wes.name: S-WE
s_wes.desc: A list of integers which should all be set to 1

s_sns.name: S-SN
s_sns.desc: A list of integers which should all be set to 1

e_verts.name: End Vertical
e_verts.desc: End index in z (vertical) direction (staggered dimension -- this refers to full levels

p_top_requested.name: P-top requested
p_top_requested.desc: Pressure top used in the model

num_metgrid_levels.name: Number metgrid level
num_metgrid_levels.desc: Number of incoming data levels (can be found by using the ncdump command on the met_em.* file)

num_metgrid_soil_levels.name: Number of metgrid soil level
num_metgrid_soil_levels.desc: number of incoming soil data levels

dxs.name: DX
dxs.desc: A real value specifying the grid distance in the x-direction where the map scale factor is 1

dys.name: DY
dys.desc: A real value specifying the grid distance in the y-direction where the map scale factor is 1

grid_ids.name: Grid ID
grid_ids.desc: Domain identifier that is used in the wrfout naming convention. The most coarse grid must have grid_id of 1

parent_time_step_ratios.name: Parent time step ratio
parent_time_step_ratios.desc: Integer parent-to-nest domain grid size ratio. Typically an odd number ratio is used in real-data applications.

feedback.name: Feedback
feedback.desc: this is the key setup to define a two-way nested (or one-way nested) run. When feedback is on, the values of the coarse domain are overwritten by the values of the variables (average of cell values for mass points, and average of the cell-face values for horizontal momentum points) in the nest at the coincident points. For masked fields, only the single point value at the collocating points is fed back. If the parent_grid_ratio is even, an arbitrary choice of the southwest corner point value is used for feedback. This is the reason it is better to use an odd parent_grid_ratio with this option. When feedback is off , it is equivalent to a one-way nested run, since nest results are not reflected in the parent domain.

smooth_option.name: Smotoh option
smooth_option.desc: this a smoothing option for the parent domain in the area of the nest if feedback is on. Three options are available: 0 = no smoothing; 1 = 1-2-1 smoothing; 2 = smoothing-desmoothing.

cudts.name: Cudt
cudts.desc: Minutes between cumulus physics calls; should be set to 0 when using all cu_physics except Kain-Fritsch (0 = call every time step)

isfflx.name: IsFFlx
isfflx.desc: Heat and moisture fluxes from the surface for real-data cases and when a PBL is used (only works with sf_sfclay_physics=1, 5, 7, or 11). 1 = fluxes are on,0 = fluxes are off

icloud.name: ICloud
icloud.desc: Cloud effect to the optical depth in radiation

surface_input_source.name: Surface input source
surface_input_source.desc: Where landuse and soil category data come from

num_soil_layers.name: Num soil layers
num_soil_layers.desc: Number of soil layers in land surface model

dyn_opt.name: Dyn_opt
dyn_opt.desc: Dynamical core option: advanced research WRF core (Eulerian mass)

diff_opt.name: Diff Opt
diff_opt.desc: turbulence and mixing option no turbulence or explicit spatial numerical filters (km_opt is ignored)

damp_opt.name: Damp_opt
damp_opt.desc: Either a layer of increased diffusion

emdivs.name: Emdiv
emdivs.desc: External-mode filter coef for mass coordinate model

epssms.name: Epssm
epssms.desc: Time off-centering for vertical sound waves

non_hydrostatics.name: Non_hydrostatic
non_hydrostatics.desc: Running the model in non-hydrostatic mode

time_step_sounds.name: Time step sound
time_step_sounds.desc: number of sound steps per timestep (if using a time_step much larger than 6*DX (in km), increase number of sound steps

h_sca_adv_orders.name: H_sca_adv_order
h_sca_adv_orders.desc: Scalar and horizontal advection orders for momentum

v_sca_adv_orders.name: V_sca_adv_order
v_sca_adv_orders.desc: Scalar and vertical advection orders for momentum

spec_bdy_width.name: Spec bdy width
spec_bdy_width.desc: Total number of rows for specified boundary value nudging

spec_zone.name: Spec_zone
spec_zone.desc: Number of points in specified zone

relax_zone.name: Relax zone
relax_zone.desc: Number of points in relaxation zone

symmetric_xss.name: Symmetric XS
symmetric_xss.desc: Symmetric boundary conditions at x start

symmetric_xes.name: Symmetric WE
symmetric_xes.desc: Symmetric boundary conditions at x end

open_xss.name: Open XS
open_xss.desc: Open boundary conditions at x start

open_xes.name: Open XE
open_xes.desc: Open boundary conditions at x end

symmetric_yss.name: Symmetric YS
symmetric_yss.desc: symmetric boundary conditions at y start

symmetric_yes.name: Symmetric YE
symmetric_yes.desc: Symmetric boundary conditions at y end

open_yss.name: Open YS
open_yss.desc: Open boundary conditions at y start

open_yes.name: Open YE
open_yes.desc: Open boundary conditions at y end

namelist_quilt.name: Namelist quilt
namelist_quilt.desc: Options for asynchronized I/O for MPI applications

nio_tasks_per_group.name: NIO task per group
nio_tasks_per_group.desc: 0=no quilting, >0 # of processors used for IO quilting per IO group

nio_groups.name: NIO group
nio_groups.desc: May be set to higher value for nesting IO or history and restart IO

interp_method.desc: 0 is model levels, -1 is nice height levels, 1 is user specified pressure/height
